intro: Hernandia moerenhoutiana subsp. samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan hernandia, is a small evergreen tree native to the islands of Samoa and nearby regions in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, coastal lowland areas and thrives in well-drained, fertile soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional medicine.
